definition: to pluck (a string)/to play (a string instrument)/to spring or leap/to shoot (e.g. with a catapult)/(of cotton) to fluff or tease/to flick/to flip/to accuse/to impeach/elastic (of materials)
to rain/(of rain, snow etc) to fall/to precipitate/to wet

sentences.english: The victim was hit by a hail of bullets.
sentences.chinese: 受害者被一阵弹雨击中。

sentences.english: He was dead, killed in a hail of bullets.
sentences.chinese: 他在一阵弹雨中中弹身亡。

sentences.english: The gunmen blasted the car with a hail of bullets.
sentences.chinese: 枪手们以一阵弹雨向汽车扫射。

sentences.english: What confidence. As if my hands could protect him from the bullets.
sentences.chinese: 多有自信啊，仿佛我的手可以帮他挡住枪林弹雨似的。

sentences.english: They work all day. Then they wait for the army to arrive, and when – finally – it does, a hail of bullets lands on the crowd.
sentences.chinese: 忙了一整天后军队终于来了，一阵弹雨洒向众人。

sentences.english: Pick up, leaves, flicking dust rain.

definition: flesh and blood flying (idiom); carnage/people blown to pieces
to rake with machine gunfire/to strafe/to machine-gun down
